question: A.1 [2.0 points, 0.5 each] Match each term in column A with the correct definition in column B.

answers.answer: a. Prompt Neutron - 1. A neutron in equilibrium with its surroundings.
answers.feedback: Incorrect. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, § 2.5, p. 2-36.

answers.answer: a. Prompt Neutron - 2. A neutron born directly from fission.
answers.feedback: Correct. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, § 2.5, p. 2-36.

answers.answer: b. Fast Neutron - 4. A neutron at an energy level greater than its surroundings.
answers.feedback: Correct. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, § 2.5, p. 2-36.

answers.answer: c. Thermal Neutron - 1. A neutron in equilibrium with its surroundings.
answers.feedback: Correct. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, § 2.5, p. 2-36.

answers.answer: d. Delayed Neutron - 3. A neutron born due to decay of a fission product.
answers.feedback: Correct. REF: Burn, R., Introduction to Nuclear Reactor Operations, © 1982, § 2.5, p. 2-36.
